intro: Sinosenecio fanjingshanicus, commonly known as the Fanjingshan sinosenecio, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of China, particularly in the Fanjingshan area of Guizhou Province. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in forested areas at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
